HomePage.title: Welcoming lives. Transforming futures.
HomePage.mission_description: We promote the improvement of quality of life for vulnerable groups in rural areas of Mozambique, focusing on the economic and social empowerment of women, youth, and people with disabilities.
HomePage.who_we_are_description: AMAVI – Hands that Welcome Lives Association is a private non-profit organization of social character, headquartered in Maputo Province (Marracuene). Legally recognized on July 29, 2025, we are dedicated to the integral development of vulnerable communities through education, health, empowerment, and social protection programs.
HomePage.areas_description: We work on multiple fronts to create real and lasting impact through integrated programs.
HomePage.area_education_desc: We promote access to education and training programs in financial literacy and entrepreneurship.
HomePage.area_health_desc: Campaigns on sexual and reproductive health and community nutrition actions focused on sustainable food practices.
HomePage.area_development_desc: Economic and social empowerment of women, youth, and people with disabilities in rural areas.
HomePage.area_social_protection_desc: Psychological and emotional support for people in situations of grief, violence, or discrimination, and care for orphaned children.
HomePage.impact_numbers_desc: Concrete results that transform lives and communities across the country.
HomePage.programs_desc: Strategic initiatives that solve real and urgent problems.
HomePage.voices_desc: Real testimonials of lives transformed by our joint effort.

ContactPage.faq_1_q: How can I make a donation?
ContactPage.faq_1_a: You can donate via bank transfer or M-Pesa. Visit our donation page for more details.
ContactPage.faq_2_a: AMAVI operates nationwide, with headquarters in Marracuene, Maputo Province. We focus on rural areas and vulnerable communities throughout Mozambique.
ContactPage.faq_3_a: Visit the volunteer page and fill out the registration form. We will contact you when there are openings.
ContactPage.faq_4_a: AMAVI was legally recognized on July 29, 2025 by the Ministry of Justice, Constitutional and Religious Affairs of Mozambique.
ContactPage.faq_5_a: To promote the economic and social empowerment of women, youth, and people with disabilities; access to education and health; development of orphaned children; and psychological support for people in vulnerable situations.

PrivacyPage.title: Privacy Policy
PrivacyPage.intro: AMAVI respects your privacy and is committed to protecting your personal data. This policy describes how we collect, use, and protect your information.
PrivacyPage.section1_content: We collect information you provide directly to us, such as name, email, phone, and address when you make a donation, volunteer, or contact us.
PrivacyPage.section2_content: We use your information to process donations, send receipts, keep in touch about our programs, and improve our services.
PrivacyPage.section3_content: We do not sell or share your personal information with third parties, except when necessary to process donations or as required by law.
PrivacyPage.section4_content: We implement technical and organizational measures to protect your data against unauthorized access, loss, or destruction.
PrivacyPage.section5_content: You have the right to access, correct, or delete your personal data. Contact us to exercise these rights.
